result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Fruits of Illegal Stop and Arrest, filed by Atty Perrin. bph    To gll

3:35 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Lauro Virgilio Sauca-Sarango in court.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Lauro Virgilio Sauca-Sarango.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Monica from Marin & Associates, Inc in court. Interpreter sworn.  Court reviews file and notes scheduled for MH.  Atty Perrin states MH has not been filed at this time, ADA Ballo states a MH was filed and makes statements regarding motion.  ADA Ballo suggests to schedule Evidentiary Motion Hearing out 45 days to allow Defense time to look into the matter. DE to appear in person for next hearing.  Atty Perrin states she will be able to get revised motion filed by end of November. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 3:46 PM. bph

11:00 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: Shirlene Renee Perrin, DF: Lauro Virgilio Sauca-Sarango appeared. Interpreter Maribel Marin. Sworn Interpreter. S/T C.Meyer (SCSO). Direct by ADA Rockow. Record to reflect the identify of DE for today. Cross by Atty Perrin. Attys reserve on arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court sets ARGN. per EFV. sf
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

- $750.00 Cash bond on file. (Moved from 21CT244)

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

03:12 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin, DF:  Lauro Virgilio Sauca-Sarango appeared, Interpreter Monica Marin appeared. INCLUDES 22CF88 (INIT) and 21CT244 (STC). Interpreter sworn. 22CF88 (INIT): Waives reading. Court notes motion to dismiss filed regarding 21CT244, notes cash bond on file, Court signs motion. State requests bond. Court orders bond on 22CF88 - money on file in 21CT244 to be moved to 22CF88. Court transfers 22CF88 to Branch 2. Court sets PH on 22CF88; confirmed with Interpreter. Adjourned: 3:20 PM. kma  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
